subject: Re: [junit] Re: Running a precondition before all tests
msgSnippet: ... An excellent suggestion. What you would build yourself, then refactor would give rise to Vladimir s work, anyway. Take care. J. B. Rainsberger, President,
messageBody:
>So said Vladimir R. Bossicard on 2003-07-15 --------------------
>> [...] Or your own custom TestRunner (the best solution)
>
>if you don't want to reinvent the wheel and want a Runner that's a
>little bit more extendable than the standard JUnit runner, you can try
>the JUnit-addons Runner. Not finished yet but you can run your tests
>with it (and define your own custom listeners and external resources).
>
>I suggest that you check out the cvs version.
>
>Everything is available at <junit-addons.sf.net>

An excellent suggestion. What you would build yourself, then refactor would give rise to Vladimir's work, anyway.

Take care.


J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
Let's write software that people understand.
http://www.diasparsoftware.com/
telephone: +1 416 791-8603
